image.altText: A woman wearing a black jacket and green top.

props.synopsis: After 24 years of Labor government, First Nations people in Australia's capital are frustrated and exhausted by a lack of meaningful progress to close the gap.

title.children: 'We are born into that fear': Canberra's failure to fix systemic racism

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe is sentenced to 30 years' jail for stabbing his Canberra zoo colleague Tshewang Choden to death in the storeroom of the kitchen area where they both worked.

title.children: Man jailed for murdering co-worker 'because he couldn't have her'

image.altText: Costumes worn in Netflix's Squid Game on display in a museum.

props.synopsis: Whether it's KPop Demon Hunters, Squid Game, or Gangnam Style, Korean pop culture has made its mark in Australia — and the National Museum of Australia's new exhibition explores just that.

title.children: Exhibition exploring influence of Korean pop culture at National Museum

image.altText: A watch, ring, bracelet, police tape.

props.synopsis: Police allege the men travelled to Australia to rob a Canberra home, stealing distinctive, luxury items.

title.children: Four French men came to Canberra for a $10m heist, police say

image.altText: A man in a yellow puffer jacket, walking with his hands in his pockets and his head down.

props.synopsis: A judge says the former art shop worker had a "complete disconnect between perception and reality" as she jails him for rape.

title.children: Man jailed for 'orchestrated' rape of customer in shop where he worked

image.altText: A row of Matildas walks towards the camera in uniform with a black background.

props.synopsis: A 23-minute video portrait of the Matildas 2023 World Cup squad is unveiled at the National Portrait Gallery, in what the institution describes as its most ambitious commission ever.

title.children: 'I did start tearing up': $400k Matildas portrait unveiled

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff dressed in court robes walks down a street. in Brisbane

props.synopsis: The man who led the inquiry into the criminal prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann loses his appeal to have serious corruption findings against him overturned.

title.children: Walter Sofronoff loses appeal against corruption finding

image.altText: Card Catalogue

props.synopsis: The NLA has more than 10 million items, but they are all in storage. Now a new exhibition reveals a selection of its hidden treasures.

title.children: It's one of the country's biggest libraries, so where are all the books?

image.altText: Albanese Wells AFL

props.synopsis: A spotlight on sports minister Anika Wells prompts fresh scrutiny of the rules about the expenses politicians can claim, including to attend big-ticket sporting events and concerts.

title.children: When can politicians bill taxpayers to attend box-office events?

image.altText: A woman dressed in a protective helmet lays under stalactites in a cave

props.synopsis: It was an adventure into the unknown. From the surface all that could be seen was a small opening. The ABC has been given exclusive access to newly-discovered caves on South Australia's Kangaroo Island.

title.children: A small opening in the ground hides a remarkable newly discovered cave

image.altText: Donald Trump

props.synopsis: When the White House quietly released its national security strategy late one night last week, it instead seemed to get lost in other news. Except, perhaps, in Europe.

title.children: Trump's quietly released national security strategy is illuminating

image.altText: Jared Kushner looks on during a swearing-in ceremony.

props.synopsis: The dramatic escalation in the fight for Warner Bros is one of the biggest in recent corporate memory, drawing an unlikely cast of celebrities and business figures including Jared Kushner.

title.children: Netflix was set to buy Warner Bros Discovery, then came the torpedo

image.altText: A composite image showing three authors and their book covers

props.synopsis: An exciting Australian debut, a bevvy of award-winning literary fiction and more than one heart-wrenching memoir are among our critics' favourite reads of the year.

title.children: The 14 books our critics couldn't put down in 2025

image.altText: Man and woman smiling at the camera with an aisle of Christmas decorations behind them.

props.synopsis: Christmas store owners say their job is "not a chore", but rather a "fun time" as they reckon with online competition in a seasonal industry.

title.children: How these family-run Christmas shops stay afloat all year long

image.altText: A blonde woman is mobbed by reporters as she walks down a street.

props.synopsis: The controversial adult content creator has faced court for flouting the resort island's road rules.

title.children: British porn star Bonnie Blue deported from Bali after 'Bang Bus' case

image.altText: A middle-aged woman gestures behind a microphone.

props.synopsis: Nobel laureate María Corina Machado says she's focused on achieving a peaceful transition of power, adding that she's confident the majority of Venezuela's armed forces and police will follow orders from a duly elected government.

title.children: Venezuela's Machado says Maduro will leave power 'whether negotiated or not'

image.altText: young woman in mosh pit wearing a cap and sunnies snaps a selfie with her friend.

props.synopsis: Australian partygoers are using walking aids to support their ketamine habit at music festivals across the country.

title.children: Drug-fuelled partygoers using walking sticks to help when they're 'gacked'

image.altText: Kate Winslet and Emma Thompson in 1800s-style dress, wearing bonnets and looking downcast.

props.synopsis: Sense and Sensibility was marketed "chick flick". But this 90s re-imagining of Sense and Sensibility starring British powerhouse Emma Thompson was more than just a bubbly romance.

title.children: How Emma Thompson made history with Sense and Sensibility

props.synopsis: Every question has only two options: one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

title.children: ABC 50/50 quiz: This week we're testing your knowledge on The Simpsons, Gremlins and fruit

image.altText: Black & white photo of Patti Smith in open shirt, jacket draped over left shoulder, leering out from cover of debut album Horses

props.synopsis: The power and importance of Horses, the seminal debut of punk-poet Patti Smith, still lingers five decades after its release.

title.children: Patti Smith’s Horses, the timeless debut that rewrote rock, turns 50

image.altText: Smoke rises from a metal bowl as people painted with ochre watch on.

props.synopsis: Victoria's statewide treaty has officially launched with a day of cultural celebrations in Melbourne.

title.children: Victoria's historic treaty formally commences with cultural celebration

image.altText: annika wells at a press conference

props.synopsis: A man accused of sending dozens of emails threatening to kill federal Communications Minister Anika Wells and her family appears in a Sydney court.

title.children: Man charged over alleged death threats to MP Anika Wells and family

image.altText: A tank on the back of a truck moves down a street

props.synopsis: The US president spoke with his Thai counterpart on Friday after indicating he would intervene to reinstate peace between the neighbouring countries, who are attacking each other at the border.

title.children: Trump call fails to secure ceasefire between Thailand and Cambodia

image.altText: Brittany Higgins walking into the ACT court with her head down.

props.synopsis: Former senator Linda Reynolds's bid to have Brittany Higgins declared bankrupt has succeeded in a federal court.

title.children: Brittany Higgins declared bankrupt by federal court

image.altText: A man and woman hand in hand outside of a courthouse, walking away from it.

props.synopsis: Celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright has been sentenced to 10 months in prison, suspended after five months, for attempting to interfere with an investigation into a fatal helicopter accident three years ago.

title.children: Celebrity croc wrangler Matt Wright sentenced to time behind bars

image.altText: A row of Matildas walks towards the camera in uniform with a black background.

props.synopsis: The 23-minute video portrait of the Matildas 2023 World Cup squad cost $400,000, in what the National Portrait Gallery describes as its most ambitious commission ever.

title.children: 'I did start tearing up': $400k Matildas portrait unveiled

image.altText: A selfie of a woman with dyed maroon coloured hair

props.synopsis: Alicia Kemp is sentenced to four years behind bars after the 25-year-old English backpacker hit and killed Thanh Phan as she rode an e-scooter while drunk in Perth's CBD.

title.children: 'E-scooters are not toys': UK backpacker jailed over pedestrian death

image.altText: A bearded man in glasses  and a dark blazer walkks near a large building.

props.synopsis: A WA masseur who described himself as a nudist and provided "internal" massages without consent is found guilty of multiple sex charges after a trial that ran for more than two months.

title.children: WA man who provided 'internal' massages found guilty of sex assaults

image.altText: Tameka Yallop yells

props.synopsis: Matildas veteran Tameka Yallop will require surgery on a serious hamstring injury, all but ending her hopes of playing at the Women's Asian Cup.

title.children: Injury heartbreak for Matildas veteran

image.altText: A man in a Transportation Security Administration uniform checks a person's passport

props.synopsis: Mean tweets about US policy might mean no trip to Disneyland, under a new proposal that would see Australians provide their social media history for the past five years.

title.children: What does US proposal on tourists disclosing social media mean for Australians?

image.altText: A massive wave bursts into the air.

props.synopsis: A natural phenomenon leaves surfers in awe of the "earthquake" wave.

title.children: 'Magic wave' found off WA coast after surfer's decade-long search

image.altText: A hospital bed is pushed down a corridor towards the camera.

props.synopsis: State health ministers had their final meeting of the year with their federal counterpart on Friday armed with figures showing a 25 per cent increase in just three months of aged care patients stranded in hospitals.

title.children: 'Furious' states attack feds over aged care patients in hospitals

image.altText: A boy in wheelchair with bandages and nasal stent smiles as he drinks a can of soda.

props.synopsis: The boy was dragged under a car for more than 100 metres, with the judge saying she does not know how he survived.

title.children: Man jailed for hit-and-run that left 3yo in critical condition

image.altText: Nemo stands on  stage after winning the trophy in 2024

props.synopsis: Swiss singer Nemo says they will return the trophy they won in 2024 over the EBU's decision to let Israel participate in 2026.

title.children: 2024 Eurovision winner returns trophy over Israel's participation
